fine_dining.name: Chambre Séparée
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate open kitchen with counter seating focused on wood-fired cooking
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2-3 months in advance, especially for weekend dining
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Kobe Desramaults' unique dining experience with just 16 counter seats; focuses on local ingredients and pure flavors; evening progresses through multiple courses; known for its innovative approach

fine_dining.name: Vrijmoed
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant and refined with minimalist décor
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve 4-6 weeks in advance, closed Sundays and Mondays
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Michael Vrijmoed previously worked at In de Wulf; known for vegetable-focused cuisine with exceptional flavor combinations; offers both regular and vegetarian tasting menus; excellent wine pairings

fine_dining.name: OAK
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2-3 weeks in advance, closed Sundays and Mondays
fine_dining.local_tips: Stylish restaurant with excellent service; focuses on high-quality ingredients with creative presentations; offers 5 or 7-course tasting menus; beautiful interior design with natural elements

casual_dining.name: Otomat
signature_dishes: Sourdough pizzas with Belgian beer in the dough
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reservations recommended for weekends, walk-ins usually accommodated
casual_dining.local_tips: Innovative concept using Belgian beer in the pizza dough; great beer pairings with each pizza; family-friendly atmosphere with good vegetarian options

casual_dining.name: Lokaal
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations needed, but arrives early for lunch rush
casual_dining.local_tips: All ingredients sourced within 150km of Ghent; menu changes frequently based on seasonal availability; excellent local beers and natural wines; committed to sustainable practices

casual_dining.name: Publiek
casual_dining.local_tips: Excellent value lunch menu; relaxed atmosphere with serious food; former Michelin-starred chef cooking more accessible dishes; beautiful plating and presentation

casual_dining.name: Brasserie Ha'
casual_dining.local_tips: Consistent quality and service; popular with locals; excellent beer selection; traditional dishes executed perfectly; good place to try authentic Flemish cuisine

street_food.name: De Frietketel
street_food.local_tips: Popular with students and locals alike; offers many vegetarian and vegan options; try the samurai sauce or curry ketchup; authentic twice-fried Belgian fries

street_food.name: Julie's House
street_food.local_tips: Perfect for afternoon treats; beautiful homemade cakes; try the seasonal specials; lovely interior design; takeaway available for picnics along the canals

street_food.name: Holy Food Market
street_food.local_tips: Located in a former chapel with stunning architecture; great for groups who want different food options; lively atmosphere especially on weekends; try the dim sum and local craft beers

coffee_shops.name: Mokabon
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Classic Belgian coffee house with vintage charm
coffee_shops.local_tips: Ghent's oldest coffee house in operation since 1937; coffee beans roasted in-house; authentic old-world atmosphere; no laptops policy encourages conversation

coffee_shops.name: Barista
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Minimalist and bright with Scandinavian influences
coffee_shops.local_tips: Award-winning baristas; excellent brew methods; friendly staff happy to explain different coffee origins; good spot for digital nomads

coffee_shops.name: OR Coffee Bar
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Industrial chic with plants and natural light
coffee_shops.local_tips: Coffee roasted in small batches; excellent brunch options; knowledgeable staff; beans available for purchase; popular with locals and tourists alike

bars.name: Het Waterhuis aan de Bierkant
bars.atmosphere: Authentic brown café with canalside terrace
bars.food_options: Cheese plates and traditional bar snacks
bars.local_tips: Beautiful location alongside the canal; over 170 Belgian beers; very knowledgeable staff; great outdoor seating in summer; try their house beer 'Gandavum'

bars.name: Gruut Stadsbrouwerij
bars.local_tips: Ghent's local brewery using herbs instead of hops in traditional medieval style; brewery tours available; tasting flights recommended; good for understanding Belgian beer diversity

bars.name: Jigger's
bars.local_tips: Hidden entrance adds to the speakeasy atmosphere; extremely knowledgeable bartenders; each cocktail prepared with precision; reservations strongly recommended for weekends

bars.name: Hot Club de Gand
bars.specialty: Belgian beers and cocktails with live jazz
bars.atmosphere: Cozy vintage jazz club with live music
bars.local_tips: Authentic jazz club atmosphere; regular live performances by local and international musicians; historic venue in operation since 1981; intimate setting perfect for music lovers

food_tours.name: Ghent Veggie Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance; showcases why Ghent is Europe's vegetarian capital; includes tastings at multiple locations

food_tours.name: Beer & Chocolate Experience
food_tours.booking_tips: Book 1 week ahead; includes 6 beer tastings and visits to chocolate artisans; comfortable shoes recommended

food_tours.name: Ghent Gourmet Walking Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Book 1-2 weeks ahead; come hungry as it includes multiple tastings; covers historical center and less touristy neighborhoods

cooking_classes.name: Flemish Classics Workshop
includes: All ingredients, recipes, full meal with beer pairing
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Reserve 1-2 weeks ahead; classes held twice weekly; includes history of Ghent's culinary traditions

cooking_classes.name: Vegetarian Mastery
includes: Organic ingredients, take-home recipes, full vegetarian meal with drink pairings
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book 2 weeks ahead; highlights Ghent's reputation as Europe's vegetarian capital; suitable for all skill levels

markets.name: Vrijdagmarkt
markets.hours: Every Friday and Saturday, 7 AM - 1 PM
markets.local_tips: Ghent's oldest and most famous market; excellent place for people-watching; surrounding cafés perfect for breakfast before shopping; best prices in the last hour

markets.name: Groentenmarkt
markets.local_tips: Don't miss the historic Tierenteyn-Verlent mustard shop in operation since 1790; great place to assemble picnic supplies; smaller but more authentic than larger markets

markets.name: Bij Sint-Jacobs
markets.local_tips: Popular weekend activity for locals; great mix of food and non-food items; lively atmosphere with street performers; surrounding cafés perfect for Sunday brunch after shopping

spring: White asparagus in Flemish style with clarified butter
Fresh herb salads with local goat cheese
summer: Ghent Festivities (Gentse Feesten) street food in July
Waterzooi made with fresh summer vegetables
winter: Carbonnades flamandes (beef stew with Gruut beer)
